section.title: Overview
section.abstract: A discussion of the literary style known as "stream of consciousness" and an elaboration of this which I am aiming to use on this website.

sbcol.subsec: In 1997 I was working full time for International Computers Limited. I was 49 years old then, and I had decided to resign my position and launch out on my own on my 50th birthday. Exactly what I was going to do was unclear, but it was going to be creative, and the main part of that creativity was to be some, or various, kinds of writing. Among the various things I were software and philosophy. I might say that writing software for bread and butter to make writing philosophy possible, but my conception of the relationship between the two was much more complex than that.

While I anticipated release from daily drudgery and the freedom to write, my mind went into overdrive on the ideas front, and a continuous stream of new ideas bubbling through my head whenever my attention elsewhere was not essential. What I wanted most, was not so much to accomplish some grand opus, as to capture this process, this facility which I then felt of coming up with new and interesting perspectives on every problem I considered. It was natural to consider the literary style of "Stream of Consiousess" and I gave that a bit of thought at the time.
